title: Impulse - saw-tooth F vs t graph

content.question: The graph shows the net force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> exerted on an object as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>. How does the impulse <math alttext="J sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> exerted on the object from <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> compare to the impulse <math alttext="J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> exerted on the object from <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="J sub 1 equals, negative J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="J sub 1 equals, J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="The absolute value of J sub 1, end absolute value, is less than the absolute value of J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="The absolute value of J sub 1, end absolute value, is greater than the absolute value of J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded><mo>></mo><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="J sub 1 equals, negative J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
